fields.summary: pdf doesn't render when base document had been scanned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33928].
  {panel}

# Navigate to a space
# Click *Create Child Page*
# Select *Product Requirements* blueprint
# Attempt to first save page without giving a title.
# Receive error about needing a title.
# Add title.
# Attempt to save.
# Receive this error:

{noformat}Cause

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33924].
  {panel}

Hi.  I'm putting this here because, well, there's no "SDK" project.

According to:

https://developer.atlassian.com/display/DOCS/Install+the+Atlassian+SDK+on+a+Linux+or+Mac+System

The tarball installation consists of these steps:

sudo tar -xvzf atlassian-plugin-sdk-4.0.tar.gz -C /opt

The contents of the tarball have borked permissions.  Since you need to be root to install in /opt (hence the sudo), all files will be owned by root.

Since you likely *aren't* going to develop as root (you shouldn't), then the permissions in /opt/atlassian-plugin-sdk/bin won't let you run anything.  Nor will /opt/atlassian-plugin-sdk/apache-maven/bin.

The shell scripts there should all be mode 755.

Also, why on earth are all the directories mode 777?  People shouldn't mess with these files, should they?

Anyway, the mode thing on the bin dir files kept people here from actually being able to use it.  This is a bug, in my opinion.

If you think it's not, then update the docs to indicate that you will have to do all your development as root. :-)

This was the case for both:

ATLAS Version:    4.2.10

and

ATLAS Version:    5.0.2
fields.summary: Confluence/Atlassian SDK tarball is broken
Disable on-screen error logging.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33920].
  {panel}

As more people use confluence, it would be very convenient to have a jira issue create button/link always available. As people work in confluence they think of issues that should be opened. If they can click a button in confluence that displays a popup of the create issue form used in the Jira Macros, they can quickly enter an issue, and continue working within confluence. This improves productivity and helps to ease the transition of new confluence/jira users.

Functionality:
- Button is available from any page
- Create form remembers the last app link and project used. This is very important. If the user is working heavily in one project, he doesn't want to have to select the app link and project every time he is going to create an issue.
- It does NOT move the user from the page he is working on. It is a popup.
- Admin can turn on/off display of the button. Or maybe configurable by space? 
- It does NOT create a link in a confluence page.
fields.summary: Add Jira Issue Create Button
Let users know when a page has already been shared with an user or email

Hello,
we have problem with this plugin. Look below the communication between as and your support team:

I said:
    My Work->Today->I choose time interval->Left button on the mouse and->Now i see Work Work screen->When I enter any symbol in field Issue key I'm seeing Error and can't log work.
    The error is:

    Error: error
    Forbidden
    URL: /rest/api/1.0/issues/picker?showSubTaskParent=true&showSubTasks=true¤tJQL=status+!%3D+closed+ORDER+BY+createdDate+DESC&query=d&_=1402387080862



Jira support said:
Hi Lyudmil,

It looks like this is coming from the plugin called My Work Calendar. We will not be able to provide technical support for issues on third party plugins as per our support policy. According to the plugin page's Support tab, you can email the plugin developer to get support, perhaps you can send him an email directly.
Thank you for your understanding. Do let me know if you have further questions on this.

Regards,
Daniel

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33913].
  {panel}

Hello

I am using an OnDemand instance.
There are 3 users who cannot be searched in Confluence in autocomplete mode. But they show up when searched using the people directory.

The other interesting observation is that only these same 3 users show up more than once in Confluence People directory. So, I feel its related to them not getting popped up in autocomplete search while assigning them to pages/messages.

They popup in Jira in autocomplete search.

Please help!

Regards
Gauri

Beginning several hours ago, our Confluence instance has been impacted by generalized sytem instability and decreased page load performance (ranging from 30 to 120 seconds).   *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33903].
  {panel}

A bug went out that caused duplicate entries in AO. In conjunction with the bugfix, we need to clean up existing clones in the AO inline tasks table. This will most likely require an upgrade task and LOTS of testing.

This effects EAC and several OD instances. 
See related ticket.

*Diagnosis and Workarounds* can be found in this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Duplicate+tasks+appearing+in+My+Tasks+or+Task+Reports]
fields.summary: Upgrade task to clean up duplicate task entries

  {panel}

,Although this request has been deemed not to be necessary i have resubmitted it,.

This very simple option of disabling email notifications for an entire Space and/or content updates as you do them, from being sent to either all users / groups on the space and/or specific users by way of a simply "tick box" setting, which does does not seen to be an unreasonable request.

The scenario is that currently my CEO wants to be copied on the space so they can have visibility of the project and some of its content.
He does not however want to be spammed every time someone updates the smallest amount of content.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33886].
  {panel}

Reordering a page (via Space Tools -> Reorder Pages) that has Task List macros that include dates causes duplicate tasks to appear under "My Tasks" view 

*Workarounds* can be found in this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Duplicate+tasks+appearing+in+My+Tasks+or+Task+Reports]

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page in a space that already has some pages in it.
# Add a task list macro, mention your own user account, add a date to the task (with '//').
# Go to My Tasks, notice the newly-added task is only shown once.
# Go into Space Tools > Re-order Pages, move the page with the task macro on it to above or below where it is now.
# Go back to My Tasks, and the task on that page is now shown twice.

The task will be duplicated each time the page is moved.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33882].
  {panel}

Under profile > tasks...the task list has duplicate data.  Suggested improvements:

1. the @ mention AND assignee column.  Wouldn't it be enough to display in assignee column?
2. the date appears as a part of the tasks description AND in the due date column.  Keep just the due date column.
3. add icons in from of the pages
4. add (maybe optional?) column for space in which this page > task is found

make all columns sortable!  That way user can start working on task by due date, or by project (space / or page depending on the particular wiki organization) 

Screenshots of 5.5.2 (current) and proposed added

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33869].
  {panel}

Confluence powers plenty of public Internet-facing documentation and knowledge base websites including Atlassian documentation. Support for HTML meta tags will enable owners and maintainers of public Confluence-based websites to have (some) control over search engine indexing and ranking. Although many modern search engines underplay or do not use meta tags, they are still useful for fine tuning. 

* *robots*: great to control if page contents/links should not be indexed.
* *description*: if an excerpt is already defined, this could be used for the description.
* *keywords*: still good when used in moderation

The plugins described in [CONF-4516|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4516] seem to be no longer available and it would be great to have Confluence support this out-of-the-box.
fields.summary: As the maintainer of a public documentation site I require Confluence to support HTML meta tags description, keyword, and robots
Create dialog should offer Group Page option or Blueprint

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Pages containing certain types of .bmp files will fail to be imported out to PDF. This affects both single-page PDF exports or space-level PDF exports that includes this page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Confluence page
# Add the attached bmp file to the page [^example.bmp]
# Export this page to PDF (Page tools > Export to PDF)

h3. Expected Results
PDF export created succesfully

h3. Actual Results
Export failed.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{code}
2014-05-28 17:50:02,236 ERROR [Long running task: PDF Space Export] [core.task.longrunning.AbstractLongRunningTask] doInTransactionWithoutResult Error during PDF export
 -- url: /spaces/flyingpdf/doflyingpdf.action | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:5542/spaces/flyingpdf/flyingpdf.action?key=TEST | action: doflyingpdf
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Exception thrown while rendering the page 'Test Page' to the PDF document /Users/rchang/atl/conf542/home/temp/pdfexport-20140528-280514-1747-6/TEST-280514-1747-7.pdf
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.convertXhtmlToPdf(FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.createPdfForSpace(FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.PdfExportLongRunningTask$1.doInTransactionWithoutResult(PdfExportLongRunningTask.java:72)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.doInTransaction(TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.java:33)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.PdfExportLongRunningTask.runInternal(PdfExportLongRunningTask.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ManagedTask.run(ManagedTask.java:35)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to read image
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.LightITextFSImage.getImage(LightITextFSImage.java:128)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextOutputDevice.drawImage(ITextOutputDevice.java:768)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextImageElement.paint(ITextImageElement.java:72)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextOutputDevice.paintReplacedElement(ITextOutputDevice.java:183)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.paintReplacedElement(Layer.java:554)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.paintReplacedElements(Layer.java:511)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.paintAsLayer(Layer.java:485)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.render.BlockBox.paintInline(BlockBox.java:265)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.paintInlineContent(Layer.java:274)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.layout.Layer.paint(Layer.java:346)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer.paintPage(ITextRenderer.java:384)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer.writePDF(ITextRenderer.java:348)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer.createPDF(ITextRenderer.java:315)
	at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer.createPDF(ITextRenderer.java:246)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.convertXhtmlToPdf(FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.java:94)
	... 12 more
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: BMP version 5 not implemented yet.
	at com.lowagie.text.pdf.codec.BmpImage.process(Unknown Source)
	at com.lowagie.text.pdf.codec.BmpImage.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at com.lowagie.text.pdf.codec.BmpImage.getImage(Unknown Source)
	at com.lowagie.text.pdf.codec.BmpImage.getImage(Unknown Source)
	at com.lowagie.text.pdf.codec.BmpImage.getImage(Unknown Source)
	at com.lowagie.text.Image.getInstance(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.LightITextFSImage.getImage(LightITextFSImage.java:122)
	... 26 more
{code}
 
h3. Notes
In the case of generating space-level PDF exports, it's worth noting that the page referenced in the error is not necessarily the page that contains the BMP files. It is simply the name of the _last page_ generated; the actual problematic page could be elsewhere.

h3.Workaround
Take out the .bmp images from the page first before proceeding with the export

Bump seraph version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33850].
  {panel}

The Documentation theme is designed so the "Powered by Atlassian" footer is always visible and thus very prominent. (The windows is separated in three elements, the header, the footer and the "page" (splitter) with the sidebar to the left and page content to the right. These three are always visible, at least on Chrome/FF).

Currently (5.5.2), the footer div's "footer-body" section has a min-height property with a value of 44px, meaning that the footer will take up an effective 55 pixels vertically on the screen. For many screens, especially laptops and mobile devices, this is far too much. Not only is it annoying for the user to have that much real estate dedicated to a non-informative footer. Worse is, it is aesthetically displeasing to look at.

The new default look moves the footer to the bottom of the page, so it is only visible when the page is scrolled all the way down. This way, it doesn't matter that the page has a huge, prominent footer. However, for the Documentation Theme, the always-visible footer should not be much larger than what is required to display the "Powered by Atlassian" line of text.

Removing the min-height css property of the footer-body section makes the footer adjust size automatically to display the "Powered by Atlassian" line of text with sufficient padding. The result is much more aesthetically pleasing than before. 

To reproduce: 
1) Open a page that uses the Documentation Theme (I assume Chrome in the following, because it has neat Developer tools).
2) Observe the excessive height of the footer, which has a lot of negative space below the "Powered by Atlassian" line.
3) Open up Chrome's "developer tools" panel.
4) Make sure the "Elements" tab is selected, and "Styles" are presented to the right.
5) In the elements display, open body -> div full-height-container -> div footer -> section footer-body. (or right-click the footer and select "show info on element".)
6) With section footer-body styles displayed, scroll down and find min-height : 44px. Disable this property.
7) Resize the window to force update, and observe how the footer looks much better.

Note: Confluence 5.5.3 (m2) adds a margin: 10px to the <ul> element in order to "even out" the excessive negative space below the "Powered by" line in 5.5.2. The footer is now less ugly, but still takes up much more real estate than needed to display the footer, which still makes the user think that Atlassians are major douchebags with their major need for showing off.

Note 2: Please check this issue on a screen with a vertical resolution of < 800 pixels to get the point.
fields.summary: Remove or reduce min-height css property of Documentation Theme's footer-body

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33830].
  {panel}

The generation of the macro body hash is not working correctly.  It happens in two spots:

1) In the MacroModuleContextExtractorImpl ([Connect Source|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/AC/repos/atlassian-connect/browse/plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/plugin/connect/plugin/capabilities/module/MacroModuleContextExtractorImpl.java#47]).  This call happens during the execution of a dynamic content connect macro.  Despite the source calling the variable {{storageFormatBody}}, its actually the view format.  *This calculation is wrong, it should be using the storage format.*  This class is a normal p2 macro which runs inside Confluence and is responsible for doing things like render the html with the iframe.
2) In the ContentMacroServiceImpl ([Confluence Source|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/browse/confluence-core/confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/api/impl/service/content/ContentMacroServiceImpl.java#113]).  *This calculation is correct, its based on the macro body in storage format.*  This call happens (eventually) after the call to the REST api to collect the body.

*Problem: Inside a normal execution of a macro, there is no (obvious?) way to collect the macro body in storage format so there is no obvious way for the connect macro to calculate the macro hash correctly.*

Ideal solution:
Rendering engine calculates the hash and passes it to each macro execution through the RenderContext.  This moves the entire calculation of the hash to the Confluence source code and makes sure its the same.

Interim solution:
Work out how a normal p2 plugin can access the macro body in storage format so it can calculate the hash correctly.
fields.summary: T26 Generation of Macro Body Hash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33828].
  {panel}

For generating links to page sections the TOC macro will currently always use the normalized text of a headline.

I propose that, if the headline paragraph contains or is directly followed by an anchor macro, this anchor name should be used by the TOC macro instead.

This has two advantages:
a) Generated anchor names by Confluence can be quite silly, if the title is long or contains non-latin glyphs or even characters like ", / (or in my case: all of that).
b) Titles tend to change, while the manual anchors will likely be more persistent. Therefore if the TOC macro would use those a user could calmly C&P links from the TOC.
fields.summary: TOC macro should use manual anchor if present
Ability to use the tab key to autocomplete an @mention in addition to existing auto complete methods,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33823].
  {panel}

When using Mentions feature, the display of mentioned user is not consistent in two states:
# Page is previewed before save (or in Page Editor)
# Page has been saved

In State 1, the mentioned user is displayed as a link.
In State 2, the mentioned user is displayed as a link *with* '@' symbol preceding the user name.

There should be a consistency in this two states.

Note: In Confluence 4.3.7, both states displays the mentioned user as a link only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33804].
  {panel}

When the a page is favourited by the user, a label favourite will be created and associated with the page in the database identify with namespace *my* and the owner userkey  in the label table. Please note, this label is not visible in the actual page.

|| labelid  |  name   |           owner              | namespace  ||
|| 21954561  |  favourite  |  2c986a1a412f9cb201412f9d12bb003e |  my ||

When a actual favourite label is created in the page,  the label does not have a owner and it is identified as global in the namespace.

|| labelid  |  name   |           owner              | namespace  ||
|| 21954561  |  favourite  |  2c986a1a412f9cb201412f9d12bb003e |  my ||
|| 1015817  |  favourite  |   |  global ||


However, when you search by label in the Confluence either using Confluence search or contentbylabel macro, both the user favourite page and the pages with the actual 'favourite label' will be listed in the result.

This can prove to be confusing and misleading.

A possible solution to this issue is to search Confluence label under the namespace 'global' only.
fields.summary: Confluence search should not list user favourited page when search by label.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33801].
  {panel}

A profile was automatically created for me a few days ago when I commented on one of the REST API pages, and I guess it copied some information from my main Atlassian account.  The problem is that my phone number is shown when a user clicks on my profile on the Developers site now, and I would like to remove it.   I've tried several times today and yesterday to edit my profile by clicking the "Edit Profile" button, but I get the following error in Firefox:

Firefox can't establish a connection to the server at id.iam.atlassian.com

Also, Fiddler shows a 502 error for this request, along with the following message:
DNS Lookup for "id.iam.atlassian.com" failed. System.Net.Sockets.SocketException The requested name is valid, but no data of the requested type was found

I apologize in advance if this isn't the place to log this issue, but I couldn't find anywhere else on the Developer site.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33783].
  {panel}

Users are unable to link Confluence pages to JIRA issues:

# Open a JIRA issue.
# Click 'More' > 'Link'.
# Select 'Confluence Page' in the left menu.
# Click *'search for a page'* under the Page URL field.
# Make sure that the 'Server' field is displaying the correct Confluence application.
# All search results for ANY Confluence page come up empty.

In addition to that, when accessing JIRA issues that are linked with Confluence pages, users should be able to see the name of the page under the *Issue Links* section:

!issue_links_correct.png!

A few days ago this behaviour seems to have changed and now users are intermittently getting an "You do not have permission to view this page" message instead of the name of the page:

!issue_links_broken.png!

(!) Clicking on the link still takes the user to the page, as expected.

Currently there are no workarounds to this situation.
fields.summary: User can't link Confluence pages to JIRA issues and gets a "You do not have permission to view this page" for Confluence pages in Issue Links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33777].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Setup Confluence with Microsoft SQL Server, PostGreSQL or MySQL
# Create a space
# Create a page
# Add restriction into the page you just created
# Export this space
# Import the exported space into Confluence instance that use Microsoft SQL Server as its database

h3. Expected Results:

Confluence should be able to import this space as it could with Confluence that use PostGreSQL or MySQL database.

h3. Actual Results:

Confluence with MS SQL server will failed to process the space import with the following stack traces:

{code}Caused by: org.xml.sax.SAXException: Error while importing backup: Hibernate operation: could not insert: [com.atlassian.confluence.security.ContentPermission#8323117]; SQL []; Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'cp_unique_user_groups'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.CONTENT_PERM'. The duplicate key value is (8257543, View, <NULL>, <NULL>).; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'cp_unique_user_groups'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.CONTENT_PERM'. The duplicate key value is (8257543, View, <NULL>, <NULL>).
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not insert: [com.atlassian.confluence.security.ContentPermission#8323117]; SQL []; Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'cp_unique_user_groups'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.CONTENT_PERM'. The duplicate key value is (8257543, View, <NULL>, <NULL>).; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'cp_unique_user_groups'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.CONTENT_PERM'. The duplicate key value is (8257543, View, <NULL>, <NULL>).
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.parser.BackupParser.endElement(BackupParser.java:53){code}

h3. Workaround 1

Remove all page restrictions from the source Confluence before generating the space export. Then re-add the restrictions in the target instance after the import

h3. Workaround 2

# Drop the constraint in the target instance:
{code}
ALTER TABLE CONTENT_PERM DROP CONSTRAINT cp_unique_user_groups;
{code}
# Restore the Space
# Re-add the constraint:
{code}
ALTER TABLE CONTENT_PERM ADD CONSTRAINT [cp_unique_user_groups] UNIQUE NONCLUSTERED 
(
	[CPS_ID] ASC,
	[CP_TYPE] ASC,
	[USERNAME] ASC,
	[GROUPNAME] ASC
);
{code}

h3. Workaround 3

[Migrate your Confluence database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+to+Another+Database] server to other [supported database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms].
fields.summary: Space Export Containing Page Restriction Fails during import into Confluence with SQL Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33769].
  {panel}

We notice that a lot of our customer have troubles upgrading Confluence when their collation (MSSQL) or charter encoding /Colation/Engine (mysql).

Because of that they end up creating support cases to address this miss behaviours during the upgrade.

We indeed added a collation checker for both MySQL and MSSQL but what we would like is to add that check in the initial setup as well, so we will get new users unable to setup Confluence due the above error (L3/L4) instead of clients with odd errors or production outages due the wrong collation in an failed upgrade attempt (L1/L2).

Fix those settings is stressful to our customers since they only find this out months after installing Confluence (during an upgrade) and most of them do not have an allocated DBA  to address these problems.

h4. Work Around:

In case you already have a Confluence installed check the set of steps on below KB to fix the database inconsistencies:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+fix+the+collation+and+character+set+of+a+Microsoft+SQL+Server+database
fields.summary: Add a database collation checker on the initial setup.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33763].
  {panel}

Symptoms:
  * If image is embedded into file then it won't be displayed.
  * Scanned PDF document (which is effectively consists of single embedded image) won't be displayed at all.
  * There is next log statement in logs: *WARN [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-1] [com.benryan.conversion.MemoryAwarePDFRenderer] drawImage Image of size 2464*3448 px dropped for memory protection*

Reason:
  * Image rendering takes considerable amount of memory and makes some OD instances crash.
  * Temporary workaround applied on confluence side is to have image rendering disabled if image is large. 


*OD workaround*:
  At the moment there is no workaround for OD (OnDemand) customers except scan documents into JPEG format instead of pdf. We're are plan to roll out on better memory calculation algorithm and better handling of concurrent macro rendering however there is no ETA.

*BTF workaround*:
  For BTF (Behind The Firewall) admins could start confluence with -Dpdf.render.memory.guard.disabled=true property in order to disable memory guard. That will make all pdfs to be rendered.
(!) Note: Disabling this memory guard can cause [OutOfMemoryErrors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Fix+Out+of+Memory+Errors+by+Increasing+Available+Memory] if a high resolution image is embedded in a PDF. 


*EDIT 21/04/2015*
  Current pdf macro is deprecated and replaced by `Files and Images` (available from toolbar). More details are onto https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Displaying+Files+and+Images

*Update 23/11/2015* 
  Condition was reversed. You won't need to put system property and by default images size within pdf is not limited for BTF installations.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33751].
  {panel}

The time it takes to load the hierarchy and then actually scroll to locate the items to select is significant and challenging to select the correct ones when a space contains hundreds if not thousand(s) of pages (e.g. our knowledgebase). 

When a user selects a custom export, please do not auto select everything and auto expand the entire hierarchy.  Allow a user to navigate the tree just like they would when in Confluence.  Expand where needed - they may just need to select a few parent pages - or, if they need child pages, they are more apt to easily locate and select the correct ones when navigating the tree as they would in the UI. 

It should also take significant less time if you are not loading the entire tree - load only until selected. 

We use the space export often to print topics, chapters, guides since there is: 
1) No method to print a selected page tree
2) The page export doesn't include the header page, copyright statement pages, toc, etc.
fields.summary: Do not auto expand selected when doing a custom space export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33748].
  {panel}

We are planning to use the new Knowledge Base space, and are very happy that Confluence now features such an easy way to build a KB.

We need to have a KB in more than just English. For now that means French, and maybe other languages later on.

This means that we need to get the How-To and Troubleshooting templates translated. What I did first was un-promoting the original templates, and creating new templates based on what the original ones contained (ctrl-A, ctrl-C, ctrl-V), then promoting those custom templates. Works great!

Sadly, that means that the Page Template Wizard does not act the same at all with the "copied" templates: 
* Instead of a modal window with the Title and Labels fields to fill, I get a full-page with two small fields for the $descriptionHtml and $contentbylabelMacro variables
* Instead of a page pre-filled with the correct title and the correct Content-by-label Macro setting, I get the text from the variables as-is, within the content.

Reading the documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+a+Template), I understand that this is the way variables are supposed to work for now. But I find it odd that the default templates would benefit from a pretty modal window and pre-filled sections, when custom templates have to fallback on something less ideal.

In the end, instead of un-promoting the default templates and promoting my own translated templates, I simply translated the default templates (save for the template title, which apparently cannot be changed).

Still, I do hope Atlassian is planning on pushing this Template Wizard feature further. This would be of tremendous help for KB administrators.

Thank you for reading.
fields.summary: Knowledge Base: custom templates cannot yet fully use the Page Template Wizard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33725].
  {panel}

Sometimes there are discussion threads within a page that I would like to show to another user not in or authorized for that specific page.  The Share button at the top of the space is great.  However I suggest we add a "Share" option within a comment (Reply, Edit, Delete, Like, Share).  

Resolution option 1
If selected at the comment level, that specific comment only should be emailed to the "new" recipient.  If the new recipient is not an authorized user of that space from which the Share button was activated, the recipient should only get a "Reply" option in the mail.  

Resolution option 2 - best resolution
If selected at the comment level, that specific comment THREAD - not just that one comment -  should be emailed to the "new" recipient.  If the new recipient is not an authorized user of that space from which the Share button was activated, the recipient should only get a "Reply" option in the mail.   I define a THREAD as when i use the shortcut "M" within a space to start a comment, and others reply to that original comment.


*Reporter*: Susan Lawrence
*E-mail*: [mailto:susanl@synnex.com]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33701].
  {panel}

If a user have a word file containing forms and use the Insert ‘Office Word’ Macro to view that file into a Confluence page he will be able to type in on the form fields.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Uses Microsoft Word to create a .doc/docx.
# To add a form to this document click in file > Word Options.
# "Customize Ribbon"
# In the right panel check the "Developer" check box.
# Now that you added the developer tab click on it.
# "Click in Legacy Tools"
!img1.PNG|thumbnail!
# Add the text form.
!img2.PNG|thumbnail!
# Save the word doc.
# Create a page in Confluence and use the insert Office macro to insert the created doc.
# Once you save the page you will notice that you will be able to type in the form fields.
!img3.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Note
* This miss behaviour *does* not cause any harms to Confluence or the attached doc file.
* I attached the "Simple Character Sheet.docx" as an example.
* You can also follow [this|http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/word-help/create-forms-that-users-complete-or-print-in-word-HA010030746.aspx] link for instructions on how to add the text forms.
* Tested with MS Office 2010/2013 document.
